required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Orthognathic Surgeries and Pharyngeal Airway Space
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Mandibular Setback Surgery Versus Bimaxillary Orthognathic Surgery on Pharyngeal Airway Space in Dento-skeletal Class III Malocclusion Patients

brief_summary.textblock: twenty-four patients with dentoskeletal deformity of class III will be divided equally into two groups and will be subjected to orthognathic surgeries group A; will be treated by mandibular setback surgery while group B will be treated with bimaxillary orthognathic surgery in the form of mandibular setback and maxillary advancement surgeries. the total pharyngeal airway will be measured on lateral cephalometric radiographs, integrating retro-palatal and retro-glossal area, and statistically will be compared preoperative, immediate postoperative, and at 6 months post-surgically

primary_outcome.measure: total pharyngeal airway space surface area
primary_outcome.description: Cephalometric analyses will be performed, the pharyngeal airway is demarcated inferiorly by a line passing through the tip of epiglottis and the superior tip of the hyoid bone, namely Line A, while the retro-glossal and the retro-palatal airway is separated by a line extending from the basion parallel to line A. All the reference points and lines were conveyed to the images . The Pharyngeal airway space was measured and compared.

secondary_outcome.description: (0-24) score to assess sleep apnea indirect

arm_group.description: dento skeletal class III patients will undergo a mandibular setback surgery and maxillary advancement
dento skeletal class III patients will undergo a mandibular setback surgery

intervention.description: 12 patients will undergo mandibular setback and maxillary advancement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- dento-skeletal class III malocclusion which needed a surgical intervention with maxillary advancement surgery and/or mandibular set-back orthognathic surgery in the form of bilateral sagittal split osteotomy
- no previous orthognathic surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with craniofacial syndromes.
- Medically compromised patients and patients with bone anomalies
